title: Chance meeting that gifted Taylor a lifeline
text:
Turn around & fly to Canberra 1:21 The chance meeting with Ricky Stuart that landed Dave Taylor an NRL lifeline   Source: FOX SPORTS IT was fate that brought man mountain Dave Taylor back to the NRL. 
The hulking forward has revealed how a chance meeting with Ricky Stuart — a man he had never met before — salvaged the rugby league career he thought was dead and buried. 
The former Broncos, Rabbitohs, and Titans wrecking ball was prepared to throw the towel in and take up a 9-5 job after his deal with Super League club Catalans ended last year. 
He was homesick, missing his family too much not to return to Australia. 
It just so happened that when he landed at Sydney Airport, Stuart was there also. 
Taylor explained in an exclusive interview with Fox Sports News 500 the events that unfolded. 
“When I flew back into Sydney from France I ran into Ricky at the airport,” Taylor said. Dave Taylor training with the Raiders. Source: Supplied 
“I had never met Ricky before, so I just went up and said hello. Like the tight rugby league community it is, if you see someone you just go up and say hello even if you don’t know them. 
“I went up and said hello, he just asked me what I was doing and I said I was going back to find a job, I miss my kids too much and football didn’t mean as much as what my kids meant to me. 
“I drove from Brisbane to Bundaberg, heading up to Rockhampton, I got a call from my manager saying you’ve got to turn around — Ricky wants you to fly to Canberra and have a meeting.” 
The rest, as they say, is history. 
Taylor met with Stuart and was gifted a train-and-trial deal with the Raiders. Raiders coach Ricky Stuart. Source: Getty Images 
He’s since shed a heap of weight and has been offered a one-year contract by the club, which is awaiting NRL approval. 
He says it was getting to hard playing football away from home. 
“I made the decision when I was in France ... I’d left to go to France and hadn’t seen my kids all year,” Taylor said. 
“I think about three weeks of the year I saw my kids, they mean everything to me and I made my decision that I was happy to come home and happy to find a normal job.”
